message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with connectivity and set agreement in distributed systems, which are topics typically covered in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. The paper also discusses Byzantine failures, which are a type of security threat, making the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category a likely fit as well. The paper uses mathematical analysis and proofs to derive its results, which suggests that the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category may also be relevant. Finally, the paper discusses the tightness of its bounds, which could be considered a machine learning or optimization problem, making the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category a possible fit as well.
